010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
033 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
034 * object structures. 
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays {@code A[r][c]}, where {@code r} is the 
036 * (vertical) <strong>row</strong> index
037 * and {@code c} is the (horizontal) <strong>column</strong> index (as common in linear algebra). 
038 * This means that matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
039 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
040 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * Note: Methods named with a trailing '{@code D}' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
044 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the supplied arguments.
045 * </p>
046 * 
047 * @author WB
048 * @version 2022/08/29
049 */
050@SuppressWarnings("serial")
051public abstract class Matrix {
052        
053        private Matrix() {}
054        
055        // TODO: check if these variables should be public and non-final
056        
057        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
058        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
059        
060        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
061        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
062        
063        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
064        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
065        
066        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
067        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
068        
069        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
070        
071        /**
072         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
073         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
074         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
075         * </p>
076         * <pre>
077         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
078         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
079         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
080         * <p>
081         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
082         * </p>
083         * 
084         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
085         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
086         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
087         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
088         */
089        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
090                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
091                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
092                        return A;
093                }
094                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
095                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
096                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
097                }
098                
099                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
100                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
101                                A[r][c] = values[i];
102                                i++;
103                        }
104                }               
105                return A;
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * <p>
110         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
111         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
112         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
113         * </p>
114         * <pre>
115         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
116         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
117         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
118         * <p>
119         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
120         * </p>
121         * 
122         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
123         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
124         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
125         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
126         */
127        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
128                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
129                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
130                        return A;
131                }
132                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
133                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
134                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
135                }       
136                
137                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
138                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
139                                A[r][c] = values[i];
140                                i++;
141                        }
142                }               
143                return A;
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * <p>
148         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
149         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
150         * </p>
151         * <pre>
152         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
153         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
154         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
155         * <p>
156         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
157         * </p>
158         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
159         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
160         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
161         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
162         */
163        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
164                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
165        }
166        
167
168        /**
169         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
170         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
171         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
172         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
173         *  
174         * @param A a matrix
175         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
176         */
177        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
178                final int rows = A.length;
179                final int cols = A[0].length;
180                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
181                int i = 0;
182                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
183                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
184                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
185                                i++;
186                        }
187                }
188                return vals;
189        }
190        
191        /**
192         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
193         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
194         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
195         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
196         *  
197         * @param A a matrix
198         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
199         */
200        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
201                final int rows = A.length;
202                final int cols = A[0].length;
203                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
204                int i = 0;
205                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
206                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
207                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
208                                i++;
209                        }
210                }
211                return vals;
212        }
213        
214        /**
215         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
216         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
217         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
218         *  
219         * @param A a matrix
220         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
221         */
222        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
223                return flatten(A.getData());
224        }
225        
226        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
227        
228        /**
229         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
230         * specified values.
231         * 
232         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
233         * @return a {@code double[]}
234         */
235        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
236                return values;
237        }
238        
239        /**
240         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
241         * specified values.
242         * 
243         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
244         * @return a {@code float[]}
245         */
246        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
247                return values;
248        }
249        
250        /**
251         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
252         * specified {@code double} values.
253         * 
254         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
255         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
256         */
257        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
258                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
259//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
260        }
261        
262        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
263        
264        /**
265         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
266         * specified length.
267         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
268         * @param length the length of the vector
269         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
270         */
271        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
272                if (length < 1)
273                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
274                return new double[length];
275        }
276        
277        /**
278         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
279         * specified size.
280         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
281         * @param size the size of the matrix
282         * @return an identity matrix
283         */
284        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
285                if (size < 1)
286                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
287                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
288                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
289                        A[i][i] = 1;
290                }
291                return A;
292        }
293        
294        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
295
296        /**
297         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
298         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
299         * @return the number of rows
300         */
301        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
302                return A.length;
303        }
304        
305        
306        /**
307         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
308         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
309         * @return the number of columns
310         */
311        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
312                return A[0].length;
313        }
314        
315        /**
316         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
317         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
318         * @return the number of rows
319         */
320        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
321                return A.length;
322        }
323        
324        /**
325         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
326         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
327         * @return the number of columns
328         */
329        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
330                return A[0].length;
331        }
332        
333        /**
334         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
335         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
336         * @return the number of rows
337         */
338        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
339                return A.getRowDimension();
340        }
341        
342        /**
343         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
344         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
345         * @return the number of columns
346         */
347        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
348                return A.getColumnDimension();
349        }
350        
351        // Extract rows or columns
352        
353        /**
354         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
355         * as a {@code double} vector.
356         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
357         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
358         * @return a {@code double} vector
359         */
360        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
361                return A[r].clone();
362        }
363        
364        /**
365         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
366         * as a {@code float} vector.
367         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
368         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
369         * @return a {@code float} vector
370         */
371        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
372                return A[r].clone();
373        }
374        
375        /**
376         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
377         * as a {@code double} vector.
378         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
379         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
380         * @return a {@code double} vector
381         */
382        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
383                final int rows = A.length;
384                double[] col = new double[rows];
385                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
386                        col[r] = A[r][c];
387                }
388                return col;
389        }
390        
391        /**
392         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
393         * as a {@code float} vector.
394         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
395         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
396         * @return a {@code float} vector
397         */
398        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
399                final int rows = A.length;
400                float[] col = new float[rows];
401                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
402                        col[r] = A[r][c];
403                }
404                return col;
405        }
406        
407        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
408        
409        /**
410         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
411         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
412         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
413         */
414        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
415                final int nCols = A[0].length;
416                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
417                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
418                                return false;
419                        }
420                }
421                return true;
422        }
423        
424        /**
425         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
426         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
427         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
428         */
429        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
430                final int nCols = A[0].length;
431                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
432                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
433                                return false;
434                        }
435                }
436                return true;
437        }
438        
439        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
440         * and columns.
441         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
442         * @return true iff the matrix is square
443         */
444        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
445                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
446        }
447        
448        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
449         * and columns.
450         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
451         * @return true iff the matrix is square
452         */
453        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
454                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
455        }
456        
457        /**
458         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
459         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
460         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
461         */
462        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
463                if (!isSquare(A)) {
464                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
465                }
466                final int n = A.length;
467                double[] diag = new double[n];
468                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
469                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
470                }
471                return diag;
472        }
473        
474        /**
475         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
476         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
477         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
478         */
479        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
480                if (!isSquare(A)) {
481                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
482                }
483                final int n = A.length;
484                float[] diag = new float[n];
485                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
486                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
487                }
488                return diag;
489        }
490        
491        /**
492         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
493         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
494         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
495         */
496        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
497                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
498        }
499        
500        /**
501         * Creates and returns a diagonal matrix from the specified 
502         * vector. See also {@link #getDiagonal(double[][])}.
503         * 
504         * @param d vector of diagonal matrix elements
505         * @return a diagonal matrix
506         */
507        public double[][] diagMatrix(double[] d) {
508                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d).getData();
509        }
510        
511        /**
512         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
513         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
514         * @return true if the matrix is singular
515         */
516        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
517                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
518                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
519                }       
520                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
521        }
522        
523        /**
524         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
525         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
526         * @return true if the matrix is singular
527         */
528        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
529                if (!A.isSquare()) {
530                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
531                }               
532                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
533                return !solver.isNonSingular();
534        }
535        
536        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
537        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
538        
539        /**
540         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
541         * using the specified relative tolerance.
542         * @param A a square matrix
543         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
544         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
545         */
546        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
547                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
548        }
549        
550        /**
551         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
552         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
553         * @param A a square matrix
554         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
555         */
556        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
557                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
558        }
559        
560        /**
561         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
562         * using the specified relative tolerance.
563         * @param A a square matrix
564         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
565         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
566         */
567        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
568                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
569        }
570        
571        /**
572         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
573         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
574         * @param A a square matrix
575         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
576         */
577        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
578                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
579        }
580        
581        /**
582         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
583         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
584         * 
585         * @param A a square matrix
586         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
587         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
588         */
589        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
590                try {
591                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
592                        return true;
593                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
594                return false;
595        }
596        
597        /**
598         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
599         * @param A a square matrix
600         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
601         */
602        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
603                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
604        }
605        
606        /**
607         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
608         * @param a first vector
609         * @param b second vector
610         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
611         */
612        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
613                return a.length == b.length;
614        }
615        
616        /**
617         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
618         * @param a first vector
619         * @param b second vector
620         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
621         */
622        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
623                return a.length == b.length;
624        }
625        
626        /**
627         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
628         * @param A first matrix
629         * @param B second matrix
630         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
631         */
632        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
633                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
634        }
635        
636        /**
637         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
638         * @param A first matrix
639         * @param B second matrix
640         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
641         */
642        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
643                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
644        }
645
646        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
647
648        /**
649         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[]} vector. 
650         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
651         * @return a copy of the vector
652         */
653        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] a) {
654                return a.clone();
655        }
656        
657        /**
658         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[]} vector. 
659         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
660         * @return a copy of the vector
661         */
662        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] a) {
663                return a.clone();
664        }
665
666        /**
667         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[][]} matrix. 
668         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
669         * @return a copy of the matrix
670         */
671        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
672                final int m = A.length;
673                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
674                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
675                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
676                }
677                return B;
678        }
679        
680        /**
681         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[][]} matrix. 
682         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
683         * @return a copy of the matrix
684         */
685        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
686                final int m = A.length;
687                float[][] B = new float[m][];
688                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
689                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
690                }
691                return B;
692        }
693        
694        // vector copying ------------------------------
695        
696        /**
697         * Copy data from one {@code float[]} vector to another.
698         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
699         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
700         * @param target the target vector (modified)
701         */
702        public static void copyD(float[] source, float[] target) {
703                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
704        }
705        
706        /**
707         * Copy data from one {@code double[]} vector to another.
708         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
709         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
710         * @param target the target vector (modified)
711         */
712        public static void copyD(double[] source, double[] target) {
713                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
714        }
715        
716        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
717        
718        /**
719         * Converts a {@code double[]} to a {@code float[]}.
720         * @param a the original {@code double[]} array
721         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[]}
722         */
723        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] a) {
724                final int m = a.length;
725                final float[] b = new float[m];
726                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
727                        b[i] = (float) a[i];
728                }
729                return b;
730        }
731        
732        /**
733         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code float[][]}.
734         * @param A the original {@code double[][]} array
735         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
736         */
737        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
738                final int m = A.length;
739                final int n = A[0].length;
740                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
741                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
742                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
743                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
744                        }
745                }
746                return B;
747        }
748        
749        /**
750         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code long[][]} whose elements contain
751         * the 64-bit representation of the original {@code double} values. Its printed
752         * representation is comparatively compact (see {@link #toString(long[][])}).
753         * This is useful for defining literal {@code double} arrays without losing any
754         * precision (by avoiding conversion to decimal representation). Note that the
755         * {@code long} are bit representations and cannot be used to perform any
756         * arithmetic calculations.
757         * 
758         * @param A the original {@code double} array
759         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
760         * @see #fromLongBits(long[][])
761         * @see #toString(long[][])
762         * @see #printToStream(long[][], PrintStream)
763         */
764        public static long[][] toLongBits(final double[][] A) {
765                final int m = A.length;
766                final int n = A[0].length;
767                final long[][] B = new long[m][n];
768                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
769                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
770                                B[i][j] = Double.doubleToLongBits(A[i][j]);
771                        }
772                }
773                return B;
774        }
775        
776        /**
777         * Converts a {@code long[][]} with 64-bit {@code double} representations to the
778         * equivalent {@code double[][]}. This is useful for defining literal
779         * {@code double} arrays without losing any precision (by avoiding conversion to
780         * decimal representation).
781         * 
782         * @param A a {@code long} array
783         * @return the equivalent {@code double} array
784         * @see #toLongBits(double[][])
785         */
786        public static double[][] fromLongBits(final long[][] A) {
787                final int m = A.length;
788                final int n = A[0].length;
789                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
790                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
791                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
792                                B[i][j] = Double.longBitsToDouble(A[i][j]);
793                        }
794                }
795                return B;
796        }
797        
798        /**
799         * Converts a {@code float[]} to a {@code double[]}.
800         * @param a the original {@code float[]} array
801         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[]}
802         */
803        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] a) {
804                final int m = a.length;
805                final double[] B = new double[m];
806                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
807                        B[i] = a[i];
808                }
809                return B;
810        }
811        
812        /**
813         * Converts a {@code float[][]} to a {@code double[][]}.
814         * @param A the original {@code float[][]} array
815         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[][]}
816         */
817        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
818                final int m = A.length;
819                final int n = A[0].length;
820                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
821                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
822                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
823                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
824                        }
825                }
826                return B;
827        }
828        
829        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
830        
831        /**
832         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
833         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
834         * @param val the fill value
835         */
836        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
837                Arrays.fill(x, val);
838        }
839        
840        /**
841         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
842         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
843         * @param val the fill value
844         */
845        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
846                Arrays.fill(x, val);
847        }
848        
849        /**
850         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
851         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
852         * @param val the fill value
853         */
854        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
855                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
856                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
857                }
858        }
859        
860        /**
861         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
862         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
863         * @param val the fill value
864         */
865        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
866                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
867                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
868                }
869        }
870        
871
872        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
873        
874        /**
875         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
876         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
877         * different lengths.
878         * None of the arguments is modified.
879         * @param a the first vector
880         * @param b the second vector
881         * @return a new {@code double} vector
882         */
883        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
884                double[] c = b.clone();
885                addD(a, c);
886                return c;
887        }
888        
889        /**
890         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
891         * to the second vector (destructively).
892         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
893         * different lengths.
894         * The second vector is modified.
895         * @param a the first vector
896         * @param b the second vector
897         */
898        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
899                if (!sameSize(a, b))
900                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
901                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
902                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
903                }
904        }
905        
906        /**
907         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
908         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
909         * different lengths.
910         * None of the arguments is modified.
911         * @param a the first vector
912         * @param b the second vector
913         * @return a new {@code float} vector
914         */
915        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
916                float[] c = b.clone();
917                addD(a, c);
918                return c;
919        }
920        
921        /**
922         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
923         * to the second vector (destructively).
924         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
925         * The second vector is modified.
926         * @param a the first vector
927         * @param b the second vector
928         */
929        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
930                if (!sameSize(a, b))
931                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
932                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
933                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
934                }
935        }
936
937        /**
938         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
939         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
940         * different size.
941         * None of the arguments is modified.
942         * @param A the first matrix
943         * @param B the second matrix
944         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
945         */
946        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
947                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
948                addD(A, C);
949                return C;
950        }
951        
952        /**
953         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
954         * to the second vector (destructively).
955         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
956         * different size.
957         * The second matrix is modified.
958         * @param A the first matrix
959         * @param B the second matrix
960         */
961        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
962                if (!sameSize(A, B))
963                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
964                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
965                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
966                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
967                        }
968                }
969        }
970        
971        /**
972         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
973         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
974         * different size.
975         * None of the arguments is modified.
976         * @param A the first matrix
977         * @param B the second matrix
978         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
979         */
980        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
981                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
982                addD(A, C);
983                return C;
984        }
985        
986        /**
987         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
988         * to the second vector (destructively).
989         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
990         * different size.
991         * The second matrix is modified.
992         * @param A the first matrix
993         * @param B the second matrix
994         */
995        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
996                if (!sameSize(A, B))
997                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
998                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
999                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1000                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
1001                        }
1002                }
1003        }
1004        
1005        // ------------------------------------------------
1006        
1007        /**
1008         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
1009         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
1010         * different lengths.
1011         * None of the arguments is modified.
1012         * @param a the first vector
1013         * @param b the second vector
1014         * @return a new {@code double} vector
1015         */
1016        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1017                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1018                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1019                final int n = a.length;
1020                double[] c = new double[n];
1021                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1022                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
1023                }
1024                return c;
1025        }
1026        
1027        // non-destructive a - b
1028        /**
1029         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
1030         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
1031         * different lengths.
1032         * None of the arguments is modified.
1033         * @param a the first vector
1034         * @param b the second vector
1035         * @return a new {@code float} vector
1036         */
1037        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
1038                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1039                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1040                final int n = a.length;
1041                float[] c = new float[n];
1042                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1043                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
1044                }
1045                return c;
1046        }
1047
1048        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
1049
1050        // non-destructive
1051        /**
1052         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1053         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
1054         * @param s a scalar
1055         * @param x a vector
1056         * @return a new vector
1057         */
1058        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
1059                double[] b = x.clone();
1060                multiplyD(s, b);
1061                return b;
1062        }
1063        
1064        // destructive
1065        /**
1066         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
1067         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1068         * @param s a scalar
1069         * @param x a vector
1070         */
1071        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
1072                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1073                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1074                }
1075        }
1076        
1077        // non-destructive
1078        /**
1079         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1080         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1081         * @param s a scalar
1082         * @param A a matrix
1083         * @return a new matrix
1084         */
1085        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1086                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
1087                multiplyD(s, B);
1088                return B;
1089        }
1090        
1091        /**
1092         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1093         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1094         * @param s a scalar
1095         * @param A a matrix
1096         */
1097        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1098                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1099                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1100                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1101                        }
1102                }
1103        }
1104        
1105        // non-destructive
1106        /**
1107         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1108         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
1109         * @param s a scalar
1110         * @param x a vector
1111         * @return a new vector
1112         */
1113        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
1114                float[] B = duplicate(x);
1115                multiplyD(s, B);
1116                return B;
1117        }
1118        
1119        // destructive
1120        /**
1121         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
1122         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1123         * @param s a scalar
1124         * @param x a matrix
1125         */
1126        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1127                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1128                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1129                }
1130        }
1131
1132        // non-destructive
1133        /**
1134         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1135         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1136         * @param s a scalar
1137         * @param A a matrix
1138         * @return a new matrix
1139         */
1140        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1141                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1142                multiplyD(s, B);
1143                return B;
1144        }
1145        
1146        // destructive
1147        /**
1148         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1149         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1150         * @param s a scalar
1151         * @param A a matrix
1152         */
1153        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1154                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1155                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1156                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1157                        }
1158                }
1159        }
1160        
1161        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1162
1163        /**
1164         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1165         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1166         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1167         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1168         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1169         */
1170        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1171                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1172                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1173                return y;
1174        }
1175        
1176        /**
1177         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1178         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1179         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1180         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1181         */
1182        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1183                if (x == y) 
1184                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1185                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1186                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1187                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1188                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1189                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1190                        double s = 0;
1191                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1192                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1193                        }
1194                        y[i] = s;
1195                }
1196        }
1197
1198        /**
1199         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1200         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1201         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1202         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1203         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1204         */
1205        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1206                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1207                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1208                return y;
1209        }
1210        
1211        /**
1212         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1213         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1214         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1215         * which is modified.
1216         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1217         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1218         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1219         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1220         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1221         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1222         */
1223        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1224                if (x == y) 
1225                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1226                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1227                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1228                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1229                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1230                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1231                        double s = 0;
1232                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1233                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1234                        }
1235                        y[i] = s;
1236                }
1237        }
1238        
1239        /**
1240         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1241         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1242         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1243         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1244         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1245         */
1246        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1247                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1248                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1249                return y;
1250        }
1251        
1252        /**
1253         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1254         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1255         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1256         * which is modified.
1257         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1258         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1259         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1260         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1261         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1262         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1263         */
1264        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1265                if (x == y) 
1266                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1267                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1268                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1269                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1270                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1271                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1272                        double s = 0;
1273                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1274                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1275                        }
1276                        y[i] = (float) s;
1277                }
1278        }
1279        
1280
1281        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1282        
1283        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1284        /**
1285         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1286         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1287         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1288         * @param A first matrix
1289         * @param B second matrix
1290         * @return the matrix product A * B
1291         */
1292        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1293                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1294                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1295                if (nA != mB)
1296                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1297                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1298                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1299                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1300                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1301                return C;
1302        }
1303        
1304        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1305        /**
1306         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1307         * and places the results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C,
1308         * which is modified (destructively).
1309         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1310         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1311         * @param A first matrix
1312         * @param B second matrix
1313         * @param C the result matrix
1314         */
1315        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1316                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1317                if (A == C || B == C) 
1318                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1319                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1320                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1321                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1322                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1323                if (nA != mB)
1324                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1325                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1326                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1327                
1328                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1329                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1330                                double s = 0;
1331                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1332                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1333                                }
1334                                C[i][j] = s;
1335                        }
1336                }
1337        }
1338        
1339        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1340        /**
1341         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1342         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1343         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1344         * @param A first matrix
1345         * @param B second matrix
1346         * @return the matrix product A * B
1347         */
1348        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1349                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1350                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1351                if (nA != mB)
1352                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1353                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1354                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1355                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1356                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1357                return C;
1358        }
1359
1360        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1361        /**
1362         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1363         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1364         * which is modified (destructively).
1365         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1366         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1367         * @param A first matrix
1368         * @param B second matrix
1369         * @param C the result matrix
1370         */
1371        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1372                if (A == C || B == C) 
1373                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1374                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1375                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1376                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1377                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1378                if (nA != mB)
1379                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1380                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1381                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1382                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1383                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1384                                float s = 0;
1385                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1386                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1387                                }
1388                                C[i][j] = s;
1389                        }
1390                }
1391        }
1392        
1393        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1394        
1395        /**
1396         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1397         * which must have the same length.
1398         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1399         * @param a first vector
1400         * @param b second vector
1401         * @return the dot product
1402         */
1403        public static double dotProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1404                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1405                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1406                double sum = 0;
1407                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1408                        sum = sum + a[i] * b[i];
1409                }
1410                return sum;
1411        }
1412        
1413        // a is considered a column vector, b is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1414        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1415        /**
1416         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1417         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1418         * m is the length of the second vector.
1419         * @param a first (column) vector (of length m)
1420         * @param b second (row) vector (of length n)
1421         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1422         */
1423        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1424                final int m = a.length;
1425                final int n = b.length;
1426                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1427                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1428                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1429                                M[i][j] = a[i] * b[j];
1430                        }
1431                }
1432                return M;
1433        }
1434
1435        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1436
1437        /**
1438         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1439         * @param a a vector
1440         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1441         */
1442        public static double normL1(final double[] a) {
1443                double sum = 0;
1444                for (double val : a) {
1445                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1446                }
1447                return sum;
1448        }
1449        
1450        /**
1451         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1452         * @param a a vector
1453         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1454         */
1455        public static float normL1(final float[] a) {
1456                double sum = 0;
1457                for (double val : a) {
1458                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1459                }
1460                return (float) sum;
1461        }
1462
1463        /**
1464         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1465         * @param a a vector
1466         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1467         */
1468        public static double normL2(final double[] a) {
1469                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(a));
1470        }
1471
1472        /**
1473         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1474         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1475         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1476         * @param a a vector
1477         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1478         */
1479        public static double normL2squared(final double[] a) {
1480                double sum = 0;
1481                for (double val : a) {
1482                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1483                }
1484                return sum;
1485        }
1486
1487        /**
1488         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1489         * @param x a vector
1490         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1491         */
1492        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1493                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1494        }
1495
1496        /**
1497         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1498         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1499         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1500         * @param a a vector
1501         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1502         */
1503        public static double normL2squared(final float[] a) {
1504                double sum = 0;
1505                for (double val : a) {
1506                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1507                }
1508                return sum;
1509        }
1510        
1511        // Normalize vectors
1512        
1513        /**
1514         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1515         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1516         * @param a a vector
1517         * @return the normalized vector
1518         */
1519        public static double[] normalize(final double[] a) {
1520                double[] xx = duplicate(a);
1521                normalizeD(xx);
1522                return xx;
1523        }
1524        
1525        /**
1526         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1527         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1528         * @param a a vector
1529         */
1530        public static void normalizeD(final double[] a) {
1531                double normx = normL2(a);
1532                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1533                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector " + Matrix.toString(a));
1534                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, a);
1535        }
1536        
1537        /**
1538         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1539         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1540         * @param a a vector
1541         * @return the normalized vector
1542         */
1543        public static float[] normalize(final float[] a) {
1544                float[] xx = duplicate(a);
1545                normalizeD(xx);
1546                return xx;
1547        }
1548        
1549        /**
1550         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1551         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1552         * @param a a vector
1553         */
1554        public static void normalizeD(final float[] a) {
1555                double normx = normL2(a);
1556                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1557                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1558                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), a);
1559        }
1560        
1561        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1562        
1563        /** 
1564         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1565         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1566         * number of elements.
1567         * @param a first vector
1568         * @param b second vector
1569         * @return the distance
1570         */
1571        public static double distL2(double[] a, double[] b) {
1572                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1573        }
1574        
1575        /** 
1576         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1577         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1578         * number of elements.
1579         * @param a first vector
1580         * @param b second vector
1581         * @return the squared distance
1582         */
1583        public static double distL2squared(double[] a, double[] b) {
1584                double sum = 0;
1585                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1586                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1587                }
1588                return sum;
1589        }
1590        
1591        /** 
1592         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1593         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1594         * number of elements.
1595         * @param a first vector
1596         * @param b second vector
1597         * @return the distance
1598         */
1599        public static float distL2(float[] a, float[] b) {
1600                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1601        }
1602        
1603        /** 
1604         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1605         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1606         * number of elements.
1607         * @param a first vector
1608         * @param b second vector
1609         * @return the squared distance
1610         */
1611        public static float distL2squared(float[] a, float[] b) {
1612                double sum = 0;
1613                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1614                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1615                }
1616                return (float) sum;
1617        }
1618        
1619        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1620        
1621        /**
1622         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1623         * @param A a matrix
1624         * @return the norm of the matrix
1625         */
1626        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1627                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1628                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1629                double s = 0;
1630                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1631                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1632                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1633                        }
1634                }
1635                return Math.sqrt(s);
1636        }
1637
1638        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1639
1640        /**
1641         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1642         * {@code double[]} vector.
1643         * @param a a vector
1644         * @return the sum of vector elements
1645         */
1646        public static double sum(final double[] a) {
1647                double sum = 0;
1648                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1649                        sum = sum + a[i];
1650                }
1651                return sum;
1652        }
1653        
1654        /**
1655         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1656         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1657         * @param A a matrix
1658         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1659         */
1660        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1661                double sum = 0;
1662                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1663                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1664                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1665                        }
1666                }
1667                return sum;
1668        }
1669        
1670        /**
1671         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1672         * {@code float[]} vector.
1673         * @param a a vector
1674         * @return the sum of vector elements
1675         */
1676        public static double sum(final float[] a) {
1677                double sum = 0;
1678                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1679                        sum = sum + a[i];
1680                }
1681                return sum;
1682        }
1683        
1684        /**
1685         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1686         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1687         * @param A a matrix
1688         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1689         */
1690        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1691                double sum = 0;
1692                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1693                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1694                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1695                        }
1696                }
1697                return sum;
1698        }
