1700        // --------------------------------------------------
1701        
1702        /**
1703         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1704         * @param A a matrix
1705         * @param row the row index
1706         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1707         */
1708        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1709                return sum(A[row]);
1710        }
1711        
1712        /**
1713         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1714         * @param A a matrix
1715         * @param row the row index
1716         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1717         */
1718        public static double sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1719                return sum(A[row]);
1720        }
1721        
1722
1723        /**
1724         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1725         * @param A a matrix
1726         * @param col the column index
1727         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1728         */
1729        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1730                double sum = 0;
1731                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1732                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1733                }
1734                return sum;
1735        }
1736        
1737        /**
1738         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1739         * @param A a matrix
1740         * @param col the column index
1741         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1742         */
1743        public static double sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1744                double sum = 0;
1745                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1746                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1747                }
1748                return sum;
1749        }
1750        
1751        /**
1752         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1753         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1754         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1755         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1756         */
1757        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1758                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1759                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1760                        double sum = 0;
1761                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1762                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1763                        }
1764                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1765                }
1766                return sumVec;
1767        }
1768        
1769        /**
1770         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1771         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1772         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1773         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1774         */
1775        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1776                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1777                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1778                        double sum = 0;
1779                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1780                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1781                        }
1782                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1783                }
1784                return sumVec;
1785        }
1786        
1787        /**
1788         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1789         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1790         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1791         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1792         */
1793        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1794                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1795                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1796                        double sum = 0;
1797                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1798                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1799                        }
1800                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1801                }
1802                return sumVec;
1803        }
1804        
1805        /**
1806         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1807         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1808         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1809         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1810         */
1811        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1812                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1813                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1814                        double sum = 0;
1815                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1816                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1817                        }
1818                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1819                }
1820                return sumVec;
1821        }
1822        
1823        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1824        
1825        /**
1826         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1827         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1828         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1829         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1830         * 
1831         * @param a a vector
1832         * @return the index of the smallest value
1833         */
1834        public static int idxMin(double[] a) {
1835                if (a.length == 0)
1836                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1837                double minval = a[0];
1838                int minidx = 0;
1839                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1840                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1841                                minval = a[i];
1842                                minidx = i;
1843                        }
1844                }
1845                return minidx;
1846        }
1847        
1848        /**
1849         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1850         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1851         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1852         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1853         * 
1854         * @param a a vector
1855         * @return the index of the smallest value
1856         */
1857        public static int idxMin(float[] a) {
1858                if (a.length == 0)
1859                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1860                float minval = a[0];
1861                int minidx = 0;
1862                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1863                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1864                                minval = a[i];
1865                                minidx = i;
1866                        }
1867                }
1868                return minidx;
1869        }
1870        
1871        
1872        /**
1873         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1874         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1875         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1876         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1877         * 
1878         * @param a a vector
1879         * @return the index of the largest value
1880         */
1881        public static int idxMax(double[] a) {
1882                if (a.length == 0)
1883                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1884                double maxval = a[0];
1885                int maxidx = 0;
1886                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1887                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1888                                maxval = a[i];
1889                                maxidx = i;
1890                        }
1891                }
1892                return maxidx;
1893        }
1894        
1895        /**
1896         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1897         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1898         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1899         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1900         * 
1901         * @param a a vector
1902         * @return the index of the largest value
1903         */
1904        public static int idxMax(float[] a) {
1905                if (a.length == 0)
1906                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1907                float maxval = a[0];
1908                int maxidx = 0;
1909                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1910                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1911                                maxval = a[i];
1912                                maxidx = i;
1913                        }
1914                }
1915                return maxidx;
1916        }
1917        
1918        
1919        /**
1920         * Returns the smallest value in the
1921         * specified vector. 
1922         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1923         * @param a a vector
1924         * @return the largest value
1925         */
1926        public static float min(final float[] a) {
1927                if (a.length == 0)
1928                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1929                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1930                for (float val : a) {
1931                        if (val < minval) {
1932                                minval = val;
1933                        }
1934                }
1935                return minval;
1936        }
1937        
1938        /**
1939         * Returns the smallest value in the
1940         * specified vector. 
1941         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1942         * @param a a vector
1943         * @return the largest value
1944         */
1945        public static double min(final double[] a) {
1946                if (a.length == 0)
1947                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1948                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1949                for (double val : a) {
1950                        if (val < minval) {
1951                                minval = val;
1952                        }
1953                }
1954                return minval;
1955        }
1956        
1957        /**
1958         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector. 
1959         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1960         * @param a a vector
1961         * @return the largest value
1962         */
1963        public static double max(final double[] a) {
1964                if (a.length == 0)
1965                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1966                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1967                for (double val : a) {
1968                        if (val > maxval) {
1969                                maxval = val;
1970                        }
1971                }
1972                return maxval;
1973        }
1974
1975        /**
1976         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1977         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1978         * @param a a vector
1979         * @return the largest value
1980         */
1981        public static float max(final float[] a) {
1982                if (a.length == 0)
1983                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1984                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1985                for (float val : a) {
1986                        if (val > maxval) {
1987                                maxval = val;
1988                        }
1989                }
1990                return maxval;
1991        }
1992        
1993        /**
1994         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
1995         * @param A a matrix
1996         * @return the largest matrix value
1997         */
1998        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1999                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2000                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
2001                        for (double val : A[r]) {
2002                                if (val > maxval) {
2003                                        maxval = val;
2004                                }
2005                        }
2006                }
2007                return maxval;
2008        }
2009        
2010        /**
2011         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
2012         * @param A a matrix
2013         * @return the largest matrix value
2014         */
2015        public static float max(float[][] A) {
2016                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2017                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
2018                        for (float val : A[r]) {
2019                                if (val > maxval) {
2020                                        maxval = val;
2021                                }
2022                        }
2023                }
2024                return maxval;
2025        }
2026        
2027        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
2028        
2029        /**
2030         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2031         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2032         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2033         */
2034        public static float[] join(float[]... as) {
2035                int n = 0;
2036                for (float[] x : as) {
2037                        n = n + x.length;
2038                }
2039                float[] va = new float[n];
2040                int j = 0;
2041                for (float[] x : as) {
2042                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2043                                va[j] = x[i];
2044                                j++;
2045                        }
2046                }               
2047                return va;
2048        }
2049
2050        /**
2051         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2052         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2053         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2054         */
2055        public static double[] join(double[]... as) {
2056                int n = 0;
2057                for (double[] x : as) {
2058                        n = n + x.length;
2059                }
2060                double[] va = new double[n];    
2061                int j = 0;
2062                for (double[] x : as) {
2063                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2064                                va[j] = x[i];
2065                                j++;
2066                        }
2067                }               
2068                return va;
2069        }
2070        
2071        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
2072        
2073        /**
2074         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2075         * which must have the same length.
2076         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2077         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2078         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2079         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2080         * @return the interpolated vector
2081         */
2082        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
2083                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
2084                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2085                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2086                }
2087                return c;
2088        }
2089        
2090        /**
2091         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2092         * which must have the same length.
2093         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2094         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2095         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2096         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2097         * @return the interpolated vector
2098         */
2099        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
2100                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
2101                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2102                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2103                }
2104                return c;
2105        }
2106        
2107        
2108        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
2109        
2110        /**
2111         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
2112         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
2113         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
2114         * specified Cartesian vector.
2115         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
2116         * @param ac a Cartesian vector
2117         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
2118         */
2119        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] ac) {
2120                double[] xh = new double[ac.length + 1];
2121                for (int i = 0; i < ac.length; i++) {
2122                        xh[i] = ac[i];
2123                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2124                }
2125                return xh;
2126        }
2127        
2128        /**
2129         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
2130         * vector, which is one element shorter.
2131         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2132         * @param ah a homogeneous vector
2133         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2134         */
2135        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] ah) throws DivideByZeroException {
2136                double[] xc = new double[ah.length - 1];
2137                final double s = 1 / ah[ah.length - 1];
2138                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2139                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2140                for (int i = 0; i < ah.length - 1; i++) {
2141                        xc[i] = s * ah[i];
2142                }
2143                return xc;
2144        }
2145        
2146        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2147        
2148        /**
2149         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2150         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2151         * @param A a square matrix
2152         * @return the determinant
2153         */
2154        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2155                if (!A.isSquare())
2156                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2157                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2158        }
2159        
2160        /**
2161         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2162         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2163         * @param A a square matrix
2164         * @return the determinant
2165         */
2166        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2167                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2168        }
2169        
2170        /**
2171         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2172         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2173         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2174         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2175         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2176         * @return the determinant
2177         */
2178        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2179                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2180                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2181                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2182        }
2183        
2184        /**
2185         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2186         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2187         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2188         * @return the determinant
2189         */
2190        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2191                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2192                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2193                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2194        }
2195        
2196
2197        /**
2198         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2199         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2200         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2201         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2202         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2203         * @return the determinant
2204         */
2205        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2206                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2207                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2208                return 
2209                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2210                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2211                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2212                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2213                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2214                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2215        }
2216        
2217        /**
2218         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2219         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2220         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2221         * @return the determinant
2222         */
2223        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2224                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2225                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2226                return
2227                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2228                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2229                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2230                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2231                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2232                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2233        }
2234
2235
2236        
2237        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2238        
2239        /**
2240         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2241         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2242         * @param A a square matrix
2243         * @return the trace 
2244         */
2245        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2246                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2247                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2248                if (m != n) 
2249                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2250                double s = 0;
2251                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2252                                s = s + A[i][i];
2253                }
2254                return s;
2255        }
2256        
2257        /**
2258         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2259         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2260         * @param A a square matrix
2261         * @return the trace 
2262         */
2263        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2264                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2265                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2266                if (m != n) 
2267                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2268                double s = 0;
2269                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2270                                s = s + A[i][i];
2271                }
2272                return (float) s;
2273        }
2274        
2275        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2276        
2277        /**
2278         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2279         * The original matrix is not modified.
2280         * @param A a matrix
2281         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2282         */
2283        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2284                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2285                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2286                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2287                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2288                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2289                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2290                        }
2291                }
2292                return At;
2293        }
2294        
2295        /**
2296         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2297         * The original matrix is not modified.
2298         * @param A a matrix
2299         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2300         */
2301        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2302                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2303                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2304                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2305                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2306                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2307                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2308                        }
2309                }
2310                return At;
2311        }

2314        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2315        
2316        /**
2317         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2318         * using the specified tolerance value.
2319         * @param a a vector
2320         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2321         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2322         */
2323        public static boolean isZero(double[] a, double tolerance) {
2324                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2325                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2326                                return false;
2327                        }
2328                }
2329                return true;
2330        }
2331        
2332        /**
2333         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2334         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2335         * @param a a vector
2336         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2337         */
2338        public static boolean isZero(double[] a) {
2339                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2340        }
2341        
2342        /**
2343         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2344         * using the specified tolerance value.
2345         * @param a a vector
2346         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2347         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2348         */
2349        public static boolean isZero(float[] a, float tolerance) {
2350                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2351                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2352                                return false;
2353                        }
2354                }
2355                return true;
2356        }
2357        
2358        /**
2359         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2360         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2361         * @param a a vector
2362         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2363         */
2364        public static boolean isZero(float[] a) {
2365                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2366        }
2367        
2368        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2369        
2370        /**
2371         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2372         * using the specified tolerance value.
2373         * @param A a matrix
2374         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2375         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2376         */
2377        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2378                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2379                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2380                                return false;
2381                        }
2382                }
2383                return true;
2384        }
2385        
2386        /**
2387         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2388         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2389         * @param A a matrix
2390         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2391         */
2392        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2393                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2394        }

2396        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2397        
2398        /**
2399         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code double[]} vector.
2400         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2401         * 
2402         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
2403         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2404         */
2405        public static double[] sort(double[] a) {
2406                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2407                Arrays.sort(y);
2408                return y;
2409        }
2410        
2411        /**
2412         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code float[]} vector.
2413         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2414         * 
2415         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
2416         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2417         */
2418        public static float[] sort(float[] a) {
2419                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2420                Arrays.sort(y);
2421                return y;
2422        }
2423        
2424        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2425        
2426        /**
2427         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2428         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
2429         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2430         * @param A a square matrix
2431         * @return the inverse matrix
2432         */
2433        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2434                if (!isSquare(A))
2435                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2436                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2437                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2438        }
2439        
2440        /**
2441         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2442         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
2443         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2444         * @param A a square matrix
2445         * @return the inverse matrix
2446         */
2447        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2448                if (!isSquare(A))
2449                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2450                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2451                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2452        }
2453
2454        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2455        
2456        /**
2457         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2458         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2459         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2460         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2461         * Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2462         * 
2463         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2464         * @param b a vector of length n
2465         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2466         */
2467        
2468        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2469                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2470                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2471        }
2472        
2473        /**
2474         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2475         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2476         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2477         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2478         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
2479         * 
2480         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2481         * @param b a vector of length n
2482         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2483         */
2484        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2485                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2486                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2487                }
2488                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2489                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2490                }
2491//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2492                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2493                RealVector x = null;
2494                try {
2495                        x = solver.solve(b);
2496                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2497                return x;
2498        }
2499        
2500        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2501        
2502        /**
2503         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2504         * @param a a vector
2505         * @return the string representation
2506         */
2507        public static String toString(double[] a) {
2508                if (a == null) {
2509                        return String.valueOf(a);
2510                }
2511                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2512                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2513                printToStream(a, strm);
2514                return bas.toString();
2515        }
2516        
2517        /**
2518         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2519         * @param a a vector
2520         * @return the string representation
2521         */
2522        public static String toString(float[] a) {
2523                if (a == null) {
2524                        return String.valueOf(a);
2525                }
2526                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2527                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2528                printToStream(a, strm);
2529                return bas.toString();
2530        }
2531        
2532        /**
2533         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2534         * @param a a vector
2535         * @return the string representation
2536         */
2537        public static String toString(RealVector a) {
2538                if (a == null) {
2539                        return String.valueOf(a);
2540                }
2541                else {
2542                        return toString(a.toArray());
2543                }
2544        }
2545

2548         * @param A a matrix
2549         * @return the string representation
2550         */
2551        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
2552                if (A == null) {
2553                        return String.valueOf(A);
2554                }
2555                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2556                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2557                printToStream(A, strm);
2558                return bas.toString();
2559        }

2564         * @return the string representation
2565         */
2566        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
2567                if (A == null) {
2568                        return String.valueOf(A);
2569                }
2570                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2571                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2572                printToStream(A, strm);
2573                return bas.toString();

2595         * @return the string representation
2596         */
2597        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
2598                if (A == null) {
2599                        return String.valueOf(A);
2600                }
2601                else {
2602                        return toString(A.getData());
2603                }
2604        }
2605        
2606        // --------------------
2607        
2608        /**
2609         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2610         * the specified output stream.
2611         * @param a the vector
2612         * @param strm the output stream
2613         * @see #toString(double[])
2614         */
2615        public static void printToStream(double[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2616                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2617                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2618                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2619                        if (i > 0)
2620                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2621                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2622                }
2623                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2624                strm.flush();
2625        }
2626        
2627        /**
2628         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2629         * the specified output stream.
2630         * @param A the matrix
2631         * @param strm the output stream
2632         * @see #toString(double[][])
2633         */
2634        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2635                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2636                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2637                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2638                        if (i == 0)
2639                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2640                        else
2641                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2642                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2643                                if (j == 0) 
2644                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2645                                else
2646                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2647                        }
2648                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2649                }
2650                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2651                strm.flush();
2652        }
2653        
2654        /**
2655         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2656         * the specified output stream.
2657         * @param a the vector
2658         * @param strm the output stream
2659         * @see #toString(float[])
2660         */
2661        public static void printToStream(float[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2662                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2663                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2664                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2665                        if (i > 0)
2666                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2667                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2668                }
2669                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2670                strm.flush();
2671        }
2672        
2673        /**
2674         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2675         * the specified output stream.
2676         * @param A the matrix
2677         * @param strm the output stream
2678         * @see #toString(float[][])
2679         */
2680        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2681                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2682                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2683                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2684                        if (i == 0)
2685                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2686                        else
2687                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2688                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2689                                if (j == 0) 
2690                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2691                                else
2692                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2693                        }
2694                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2695                }
2696                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2697                strm.flush();
2698        }
2699        
2700        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2701        
2702        public static void printToStream(long[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2703                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2704                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2705                        if (i == 0)
2706                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2707                        else
2708                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2709                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2710                                if (j == 0) 
2711                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%dL", A[i][j]);
2712                                else
2713                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c %dL", SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2714                        }
2715                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2716                }
2717                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2718                strm.flush();
2719        }
2720
2721        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2722        
2723        /** Thrown when the dimensions of matrix/vector arguments do not match. */
2724        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {          
2725                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2726                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2727                }
2728                public IncompatibleDimensionsException(String msg) {
2729                        super(msg);
2730                }
2731        }
2732        
2733        /** Thrown when a non-square matrix is encountered where a square matrix is assumed. */
2734        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2735                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2736                        super("square matrix expected");
2737                }
2738                public NonsquareMatrixException(String msg) {
2739                        super(msg);
2740                }
2741        }
2742        
2743        /** Thrown when source and target objects are identical but shouldn't. */
2744        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2745                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2746                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2747                }
2748                public SameSourceTargetException(String msg) {
2749                        super(msg);
2750                }
2751        }
2752        
2753        /** Thrown when the length of some vector is zero. */
2754        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {        
2755                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2756                        super("vector length must be at least 1");
2757                }
2758                public ZeroLengthVectorException(String msg) {
2759                        super(msg);
2760                }
2761        }
2762        
2763        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2764        
2765        public static void main(String[] args) {
2766                double s = Double.NaN;
2767                s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
2768                System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
2769                System.out.println((double[]) null);
2770                
2771                double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
2772                                -1,2,3,4,
2773                                5,6,7,8,
2774                                9,10,11,12,
2775                                13,14,15,16,
2776                                17,18,19, Double.NaN);
2777                System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
2778                
2779//              RealMatrix B = makeRealMatrix(5, 4);
2780//              System.out.println("B = \n" + toString(B.getData()));
2781                
2782                long[][] AL = Matrix.toLongBits(A);
2783                System.out.println("AL = \n" + toString(AL));
2784                
2785                double[][] A2 = Matrix.fromLongBits(AL);
2786                System.out.println("A2 = \n" + toString(A2));
2787                
2788                double[][] A3 = Matrix.fromLongBits(new long[][]
2789                                {{-4616189618054758400L, 4611686018427387904L, 4613937818241073152L, 4616189618054758400L}, 
2790                                 {4617315517961601024L, 4618441417868443648L, 4619567317775286272L, 4620693217682128896L}, 
2791                                 {4621256167635550208L, 4621819117588971520L, 4622382067542392832L, 4622945017495814144L}, 
2792                                 {4623507967449235456L, 4624070917402656768L, 4624633867356078080L, 4625196817309499392L}, 
2793                                 {4625478292286210048L, 4625759767262920704L, 4626041242239631360L, 9221120237041090560L}});
2794                
2795                System.out.println("A3 = \n" + toString(A3));
2796                
2797        }
